ghost

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • ghost.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Player represents Waka.

      • Player

        public Player(int x,
              int y,
              processing.core.PImage player,
              processing.core.PImage playerLeft,
              processing.core.PImage playerRight,
              processing.core.PImage playerUp,
              processing.core.PImage playerDown,
              int speed,
              processing.core.PApplet app)
        Constructs a new Player object. The instance stores the parameters as its own properties.
        Parameters:
        x - x-axis position
        y - y-axis position
        player - the image of player
        playerLeft - the image of playerLeft
        playerRight - the image of playerRight
        playerUp - the image of playerUp
        playerDown - the image of playerDown
        speed - the speed of player
        app - An object of class App

      • directionNum

        public static int directionNum(int key)
        Receive keyboard input and convert it into the corresponding direction 0 represents up
        1 represents left
        2 represents right
        3 represents down
        Parameters:
        key - keyCode, up: 38, left: 37, right: 39, down: 40
        Returns:
        return the number representing the direction button in keyboard. If the keyCode not in 38, 37, 39, 40 return -1.

      • debugMode

        public void debugMode(processing.core.PApplet app,
                      java.util.List<Chaser> allGhosts)
        Start the debug mode according to the value of the field: debug.

        If any reference parameter is null, do nothing.

        Parameters:
        app - An object of App class which is a subclass of PApplet.
        allGhosts - A list of all objects of ghosts.

      • drawPlayer

        public void drawPlayer(processing.core.PApplet app,
                       int frameCount,
                       java.util.List<Chaser> allGhosts)
        Draw the player and the line between the player and all ghosts according to whether debug mode is enabled.

        In one 8 frame, draw the player of closed mouth and in the next 8 frame, draw the player with open mouth.
        If any reference parameter is null, do nothing.

        Parameters:
        app - An object of App class which is a subclass of PApplet
        frameCount - The number of current frame
        allGhosts - The list of objects of all ghosts

      • drawLives

        public void drawLives(processing.core.PApplet app,
                      int lives)
        Draw the remaining lives of the player on the bottom of the screen.
        Parameters:
        app - An object of App class which is a subclass of PApplet
        lives - The remaining number of lives

      • eat

        public java.lang.String eat(java.util.List<Fruit> fruits,
                            java.util.List<Chaser> ghosts)
        Eat the fruit in the current position and return the type of the fruit. If any reference parameter is null, return false.
        Parameters:
        fruits - The list of all fruits including super fruits
        ghosts - The list of all ghosts
        Returns:
        If it is a common fruit return "fruit", if it is a super fruit, return "superFruit". If it is a soda can, return "soda".

      • receiveKeyboard

        public void receiveKeyboard(int dir,
                            processing.core.PApplet app)
        Receive keyboard input and convert it into the corresponding direction Then change the direction of the player and change the displacement in a specific direction If any reference parameter is null, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        dir - The number representation of direction
        app - An object of App class which is a subclass of PApplet

      • up

        public void up()
        Change up displacement and change the direction of player into up.

      • left

        public void left()
        Change left displacement and change the direction of player into left.

      • right

        public void right()
        Change right displacement and change the direction of player into right.

      • down

        public void down()
        Change down displacement and change the direction of player into down.

      • move

        public void move()
        Move the player according to field 'goHorizon' and field 'goVertical'
        When goHorizon is greater than 0, it means y-axis plus goHorizon which is positive, go down, vice versa.
        When goVertical is greater than 0, it means x-axis plus goVertical which is positive, go right, vice versa.

      • playerMove

        public void playerMove(processing.core.PApplet app,
                       Player player,
                       boolean keyPressed,
                       int keyCode,
                       MyMap map,
                       int frameCount)
        Move the player according to the keyCode If any reference parameter is null, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        app - An object of App class which is a subclass of PApplet.
        player - An object of Player class
        keyPressed - Whether press the keyboard, pressed is true, not pressed is false
        keyCode - The number of the button pressed in keyboard
        map - An object of MyMap class
        frameCount - The number of current frame.
